content.text: Answer the questions based on the table given below:

hint.text:
The empirical (or experimental) probability P(E) of an event E is given by:
\(P(E) = \frac{Number\;of\;trials\;in\;which\;E\;has\;happened}{Total\;number\;of\;trials}\)

Also, a number is divisible by 3 if the sum of its digits are divisble by 3.
